definition: thick pole/bar/rod/thick line/to mark with a thick line/to sharpen (knife)/(old) coffin-bearing pole
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns
financial leverage/leveraging (i.e. buying shares on borrowed funds)
deleveraging (i.e. paying off part of a leverage loan)

sentences.english: They prised the box open with a lever.
sentences.chinese: 他们用杠杆把箱子撬开。

sentences.english: Besides, a significant part of the business sector is highly levered .
sentences.chinese: 除了商业部门的有效部分会使用高杠杆。

sentences.english: It was an old-fashioned lift, operated by a lever on a brass box.
sentences.chinese: 这是一部老式的电梯，由一个黄铜框架上的杠杆操纵。

sentences.english: First, the leverage is the whole point.
sentences.chinese: 第一，杠杆作用是整个要点。

sentences.english: Closed-end funds carry more risk because of financial leverage.
sentences.chinese: 封闭式基金因为财务杠杆存在更多的风险。

sentences.english: And he made bars of setim wood, which he overlaid with gold.
sentences.chinese: 又用皂荚木做了杠杆，包上了金。

sentences.english: Each party insists that its levers will work best.
sentences.chinese: 每个党派都坚持认为各自的杠杆最有效。

sentences.english: This gave it an end-of-quarter appearance of being less leveraged.
sentences.chinese: 这使得其在季末表面看起来金融杠杆不那么长。
婚姻是最伟大的杠杆原理。

sentences.english: Chinese households' leverage ratio is still quite low.
sentences.chinese: 中国家庭的杠杆率仍然相当低。

sentences.english: Control panel overwhelms with levers, buttons and lights.
sentences.chinese: 满是杠杆，按钮和灯的控制面板。

sentences.english: Always work from a secure position, keeping both feet on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 操作杠杆时务必保持双脚蹬地，占据安全位置。

sentences.english: Find the lever of the earth since prize, you can become lazier.
sentences.chinese: 找到撬起地球的杠杆，你就能变得更懒。

sentences.english: Such investment has been made principally using company funds supplemented with financial leverage.
sentences.chinese: 这些投资主要来自于公司通过财务杠杆补充的资金。

sentences.english: The pistons go up and down as a person stands on lever devices- treadles- and uses a natural walking motion.
sentences.chinese: 人站在杠杆设置踏板上来回走动，活塞就会上下移动。

sentences.english: These pleasures the rat lever machine wasn't giving us.
sentences.chinese: 这些快乐是老鼠杠杆机器无法给与我们的。

definition: financial leverage/leveraging (i.e. buying shares on borrowed funds)
to be in debt/to incur debts/liability (finance)
to invest in stock/to buy shares
